content:
• Friday, March 23, 2012
  • MY

    China Ming Yang Wind Power (NYSE:MY) sees Q4 revenue down 53% Y/Y due to project delays due to...

    China Ming Yang Wind Power (NYSE:MY) sees Q4 revenue down 53% Y/Y due to project delays due to weather and slower growth. Revenue for FY11 is expected to maintain at a similar level as 2010. Shares -12% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:40 PM
  • AWI

    Armstrong Worldwide (NYSE:AWI), a maker of flooring and ceiling products, rises 2.9% AH after...

    Armstrong Worldwide (NYSE:AWI), a maker of flooring and ceiling products, rises 2.9% AH after announcing an $8.55/share special dividend. The dividend, which will cost Armstron nearly $500M based on its current share count, will be financed using a combo of on-hand cash and $250M in debt obtained through the expansion of an existing credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) IPO speculators drive the Firsthand Technology Value Fund (SVVC +11.8%) to...

    Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) IPO speculators drive the Firsthand Technology Value Fund (SVVC +11.8%) to new highs after the fund discloses it has bought another 70K shares of the social networking giant, raising its total stake to 600K. The transaction was initiated in January, before Facebook had its post-IPO filing pop. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • AOL

    AOL (AOL +4%) spikes higher into the close on reports that the company is in talks with Evercore...

    AOL (AOL +4%) spikes higher into the close on reports that the company is in talks with Evercore to find a buyer for its 800-patent portfolio.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • GME

    GameStop (GME +2.3%) shares are still undervalued, says Sterne Agee. Sterne Agee believes the...

    GameStop (GME +2.3%) shares are still undervalued, says Sterne Agee. Sterne Agee believes the company's higher than expected Q4 EPS yesterday demonstrate that the company's initiatives are still underappreciated, and growth will continue to accelerate.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • CAM

    Cameron (CAM +3%) moves up on an upgrade to Top Pick on valuation at RBC Capital, citing its...

    Cameron (CAM +3%) moves up on an upgrade to Top Pick on valuation at RBC Capital, citing its healthy earnings growth outlook. The firm also raises its price target to $70 from $62.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • SR-OLD

    Printing and communications company Standard Register (SR-OLD +10.5%) signs an agreement with...

    Printing and communications company Standard Register (SR-OLD +10.5%) signs an agreement with HealthTrust, a group purchasing company serving ~12,000 U.S. healthcare facilities, that includes for the first time a contract for HealthTrust to use SR’s automation software for patient registration, identification and clinical workflow.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • VECO

    B. Riley starts coverage of the LED lighting sector, tagging Veeco (VECO +3.2%), Aixtron (AIXG...

    B. Riley starts coverage of the LED lighting sector, tagging Veeco (VECO +3.2%), Aixtron (AIXG +3.4%) and Cree (CREE +2.1%) with Buy ratings and Rubicon (RBCN +4.4%) at Neutral. Orders at VECO and AIXG could snap back in H2 2012 "driven by improving general lighting demand"; CREE should rise as "general lighting demand [is] expected to drive the LED cyclical recovery."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • FIO

    Enterprise flash memory hardware vendors Fusion-io (FIO +3.7%) and STEC (STEC +3.2%) are...

    Enterprise flash memory hardware vendors Fusion-io (FIO +3.7%) and STEC (STEC +3.2%) are rallying, possibly thanks to a Goldman report mentioning them as takeover candidates. Each company has already seen its share of M&A speculation (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • CVG

    Stifel Nicolaus downgrades Convergys (CVG -3.6%) to Hold from Buy and lowers its estimates after...

    Stifel Nicolaus downgrades Convergys (CVG -3.6%) to Hold from Buy and lowers its estimates after the back-office services provider yesterday unveiled plans to sell its billing, customer care and revenue management systems to NEC Corp. for ~$450M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • SD

    SandRidge Energy (SD +7.9%) surges on takeover chatter, even as TheStreet.com's Eric Rosenbaum...

    SandRidge Energy (SD +7.9%) surges on takeover chatter, even as TheStreet.com's Eric Rosenbaum lists four reasons why any deal is unlikely. Shares also may be helped by a positive mention from Jim Cramer, who calls the stock "a decent spec. Every time oil comes down a couple of bucks, this gets hammered... I like SD."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 2 Comments
  • MS

    RBC Capital adds to Morgan Stanley's (MS +4.1%) upside today after upgrading the shares to...

    RBC Capital adds to Morgan Stanley's (MS +4.1%) upside today after upgrading the shares to Sector Perform, citing potential accretion from the buy-out of the minority MSSB interest.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • ESL

    Esterline Technologies (ESL +8.8%) shares jump after the Daily Mail speculates the company may...

    Esterline Technologies (ESL +8.8%) shares jump after the Daily Mail speculates the company may be a takeover target for BAE Systems (OTCPK:BAESY), Boeing (NYSE:BA) or Lockheed Martin (NYSE:LMT), and that one of them is about to begin a bid of more than $95/share. ESL is a parts supplier for the aerospace and defense industry, and is considered among the most undervalued stocks in the sector.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • AET

    Aetna (AET -2.3%) shares slip as Goldman Sachs downgrades the health insurer to Neutral from Buy...

    Aetna (AET -2.3%) shares slip as Goldman Sachs downgrades the health insurer to Neutral from Buy with a $54 price target. The downgrade reflects more limited growth prospects in the commercial health plan business, the firm says; while Aetna is still a good growth story, the growth outlook is "limiting."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • LGF.A

    Piper Jaffray says Hunger Games may be the highest grossing March release ever. Midnight sales...

    Piper Jaffray says Hunger Games may be the highest grossing March release ever. Midnight sales are roughly translating into a $325M domestic box office performance, well above the firm's current $225M estimate. The firm recommends buying: Lions Gate (LGF -1.2%), IMAX (IMAX -0.9%), Cinemark (CNK +1.5%), Regal Entertainment (RGC +1.2%) and Carmike Cinemas (CKEC +2.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • BATS

    A bad day for BATS keeps getting worse. Trading in its IPO has been delayed once again; BATS,...

    A bad day for BATS keeps getting worse. Trading in its IPO has been delayed once again; BATS, which is launching the IPO on its own exchange, blames the hold-up on a "system overload." (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • QLIK

    Roth Capital says any weakness in Qlik Technologies (QLIK +0.8%) is good entry point. The firm...

    Roth Capital says any weakness in Qlik Technologies (QLIK +0.8%) is good entry point. The firm is upping its Q1, FY12, and FY13 revenue estimates above consensus levels, as its channel checks suggest that the company is gaining share. The firm maintains its $36 target and Buy rating on the stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • TXT

    Textron (TXT +3%) rises after its Cessna unit signs two somewhat-vague strategic agreements with...

    Textron (TXT +3%) rises after its Cessna unit signs two somewhat-vague strategic agreements with China's AVIC. One involves the creation of JVs that will "pursue various activities" related to developing aviation businesses, including an aircraft service network, and the other involves a JV to produce mid-size Cessna business jets, as well as "a potential new product for the business jet market."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • FSLR

    A compromise looks to have been reached that will result in more moderate than expected solar...

    A compromise looks to have been reached that will result in more moderate than expected solar energy subsidy cuts in Germany, reports pv magazine. Solar socks are bouncing. FSLR -1.7%, TSL +5.7%, YGE +4.5%. ETF: TAN +2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • WTSL

    Piper Jaffray piles on to Wet Seal (WTSLA -8.5%) today, downgrading the shares to Neutral on the...

    Piper Jaffray piles on to Wet Seal (WTSLA -8.5%) today, downgrading the shares to Neutral on the back of the retailer's Q4 results miss. The firm alsos lowers its price target to $3.50 from $4.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • BATS

    BATS is having a pretty bad PR day. After a trade on its exchange triggered a flash crash in...

    BATS is having a pretty bad PR day. After a trade on its exchange triggered a flash crash in Apple, the company temporarily halted all trading in symbols ranging from A-BFZZZ. Meanwhile, BATS' own IPO was halted after seeing (cancelled) trades go down at a price of $.04, and is now scheduled to occur at 1:20PM ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 2 Comments

  • Iranian crude oil exports have fallen by 300,000 barrels/day in March, Reuters reports, a drop...

    Iranian crude oil exports have fallen by 300,000 barrels/day in March, Reuters reports, a drop of 14% in Iran’s exports attributed to growing compliance to U.S.-led sanctions. Nymex crude spiked to $108.25, pulled back, and have steadily climbed back to $107, up 1.6%. Pres. Obama weighs in on the issue, saying Middle East tensions could add $20-$30 to oil prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 18 Comments
  • ACDVF

    Air Canada (AIDIF.PK) obtains an injunction that ends a bitter wildcat strike by workers that...

    Air Canada (AIDIF.PK) obtains an injunction that ends a bitter wildcat strike by workers that resulted in widespread cancellations and delays of its flights. Shares are -3.3% in Toronto trading.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -4.4%) is started at Underperform by Needham, which expects strong growth to...

    Zynga (ZNGA -4.4%) is started at Underperform by Needham, which expects strong growth to continue "at a substantially lower rate" and cites "greater competition, user churn and slowing growth of Facebook’s user base." Shares are smacked today by news that insiders plan to sell 43M shares in an offering that will attempt to stagger a flood of shares when the initial lockup periods end.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • EDAP

    Shares of EDAP (EDAP -13.1%) fall off after the company announces a plan to raise funds in a...

    Shares of EDAP (EDAP -13.1%) fall off after the company announces a plan to raise funds in a direct offering of 5.6M shares to institutional investors at a price of $2 a share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • WTW

    Weight Watchers (WTW -4.6%) sees its market cap thinned after announcing its Dutch tender offer...

    Weight Watchers (WTW -4.6%) sees its market cap thinned after announcing its Dutch tender offer to buy back $720M worth of stock resulted in 8.78M shares (11.9% of outstanding shares) being purchased at a price of $82 - the stock is currently trading at $78.66. Weight Watchers also says it expects to purchase 9.5M shares from majority shareholder Artal Holdings at $82/share. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • SOL

    Shares of ReneSola (SOL -0.1%) move lower after BofA downgrades share to Underperform on a...

    Shares of ReneSola (SOL -0.1%) move lower after BofA downgrades share to Underperform on a valuation call tied to SOL's +67.3% YTD run.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • VIPS

    Vipshop's (NYSE:VIPS) IPO is looking like a dud. Shares are trading at $5.75, down 11.5% from an...

    Vipshop's (NYSE:VIPS) IPO is looking like a dud. Shares are trading at $5.75, down 11.5% from an offering price of $6.50. The fact the flash sales site posted a net loss of $107.3M last year on revenue of $227.1M could have something to do with the drop. (F-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 3 Comments
  • PCTI

    PCTEL (PCTI -6.7%) takes a hit after lowering its revenue target for Q1, saying delayed spending...

    PCTEL (PCTI -6.7%) takes a hit after lowering its revenue target for Q1, saying delayed spending by wireless carriers has hindered its order rate during the period.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -0.3%) resumes trading after an apparent "fat finger" sends the shares from near...

    Apple (AAPL -0.3%) resumes trading after an apparent "fat finger" sends the shares from near $600 to $542.80, and sets off the stock's circuit breaker.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 31 Comments
  • IPAS

    Mobile VPN service provider iPass (IPAS +6%) is shooting higher after dealReporter states the...

    Mobile VPN service provider iPass (IPAS +6%) is shooting higher after dealReporter states the company could be up for sale. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • OVRL

    Overland Storage (OVRL -14.3%) trades off after pricing its 3.2M share secondary offering at...

    Overland Storage (OVRL -14.3%) trades off after pricing its 3.2M share secondary offering at $2.00, a 13% discount to Thursday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • CROX

    Nike's worrisome FQ3 report spills over to taint shares of other companies that sell shoes for a...

    Nike's worrisome FQ3 report spills over to taint shares of other companies that sell shoes for a buck. Decliners: Crocs (CROX -2.3%), K-Swiss (KSWS -4.4%), Under Armour (UA -1.9%) and Deckers Outdoor (DECK -1.8%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -25.1%) shares fall the most in three years after the maker of online...

    KITDigital (OTC:KITD -25.1%) shares fall the most in three years after the maker of online video software accepts the resignations of four board members. KITD's CEO will transition to board chairman and its chief administrative officer will become acting CEO while a search is conducted for a full-time, permanent CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • FDX

    Dahlman Rose says the weakness in FedEx (FDX -1.4%) recently has created a buying opportunity....

    Dahlman Rose says the weakness in FedEx (FDX -1.4%) recently has created a buying opportunity. The firm said FedEx continues to report impressive ground margins and that shares remain inexpensive. It reiterates its Buy rating with a $104 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • BMY

    The European Commission approves the Byetta Type 2 diabetes treatment developed by Amylin...

    The European Commission approves the Byetta Type 2 diabetes treatment developed by Amylin Pharmaceuticals (AMLN +1.6%) and Eli Lilly (LLY -0.1%) for a new use as an add-on therapy to basal insulin. The FDA approved the same expanded use last fall.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • MDSO

    Shares of Medidata Solutions (MDSO +7.1%) trek higher after Jefferies upgrades the company to a...

    Shares of Medidata Solutions (MDSO +7.1%) trek higher after Jefferies upgrades the company to a Buy rating and lifts its price target to $31 from a previous mark of $21.50. Analysts with the firm gush that projected revenue growth for MDSO makes current valuation "attractive" - especially for a pure-SaaS name.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • NKE

    Nike (NKE -4%) trades lower following its FQ3 report, as gross margin and inventory worries take...

    Nike (NKE -4%) trades lower following its FQ3 report, as gross margin and inventory worries take precedence over healthy top-line trends. During its earnings call, the shoe giant said it expects gross margin to rise Q/Q in FQ4, but still be down 100 bps Y/Y. In addition, though maintaining a Buy, Citi is removing Nike from its Top Picks Live list, citing the stock's 2012 gains and a lack of a catalyst until May.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM

  • Stocks add to losses following disappointing new home sales (January revised lower as well)....

    Stocks add to losses following disappointing new home sales (January revised lower as well). Builders certainly can't blame the weather or mortgage rates. Scott Barber points out NAHB optimism isn't yet being confirmed by better data on sales. S&P 500 -0.4%, Nasdaq -0.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 4 Comments
  • GLUU

    Shares of Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU) keep rolling right along - now up 19.6% - following an...

    Shares of Glu Mobile (NASDAQ:GLUU) keep rolling right along - now up 19.6% - following an upgrade from Needham. Canaccord is also out with comments on the company, saying that recent acquisitions in the mobile gaming space have gone off at 6X-7X revenue and that it sees GLUU as a potential target for a bigger player in the space.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • MU

    Micron (MU -3.6%) is selling off after delivering a mixed FQ2 report; earnings were pressured by...

    Micron (MU -3.6%) is selling off after delivering a mixed FQ2 report; earnings were pressured by large DRAM and NAND flash price declines, which led to a 200 bps Q/Q drop in gross margin to a mere 13%. While Micron said on its earnings call DRAM prices are finally stabilizing, it also said NAND prices are down sharply in FQ3 thus far, and that's contributing to the weakness seen in its shares, as well as those of rival SanDisk (SNDK -3.7% - previously).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +16.2%) is initiated at Strong Buy with an $8 target price at Needham:...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +16.2%) is initiated at Strong Buy with an $8 target price at Needham: "GLUU’s smartphone growth has been hidden in recent years by the decline of its feature phone revenue, but its new model is based on owned-IP... As the global installed base of smartphones and tablets grows and GLUU’s low-margin feature phone revenues burn off, we expect significant gains in profitability."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • BT

    Shares of BT Group (NYSE:BT) tack on a 6.1% gain after the British telecomm firm announces that...

    Shares of BT Group (NYSE:BT) tack on a 6.1% gain after the British telecomm firm announces that it reached an agreement to cuts its pension shortfall by close to 50%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • PHM

    PulteGroup (NYSE:PHM) -4.4% premarket on reports of increased pressure from the Labor Department...

    PulteGroup (NYSE:PHM) -4.4% premarket on reports of increased pressure from the Labor Department amid an investigation into housing industry pay practices. At issue is whether subcontractors hired by the big home builders are paid proper minimum wages, overtime and other benefits as required by U.S. labor law. LEN, KBH, DHI and NVR also are being investigated.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM | 2 Comments
  • NCIT

    NCI (NASDAQ:NCIT) +23.1% premarket after the government IT services provider is awarded a U.S....

    NCI (NASDAQ:NCIT) +23.1% premarket after the government IT services provider is awarded a U.S. Air Force Design Engineering and Support Program contract with a ceiling value of $1.9B. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • GLUU

    Premarket gainers: GLUU +9%. CVO +4%. MWW +4%. LGF +3%. HERO +3%. MOS +3%.Losers: KBH -16%. SPF...

    Premarket gainers: GLUU +9%. CVO +4%. MWW +4%. LGF +3%. HERO +3%. MOS +3%.
    Losers: KBH -16%. SPF -6%. PHM -4%. GEL -4%. GOLD -4%. HOV -4%. KORS -3%. BZH -3%. MU -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • GOLD

    Randgold (NYSE:GOLD) shares continue their recent rout, -3.8% premarket as Citigroup and J.P....

    Randgold (NYSE:GOLD) shares continue their recent rout, -3.8% premarket as Citigroup and J.P. Morgan each downgrade their stock ratings. Randgold yesterday slumped the most since Oct. 2008 after a military coup in Mali, where the company mines two-thirds of its gold. Sammy Pollack writes that the event highlights the advantages of gold mining ETFs.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM
  • KBH

    It's too far too fast for KB Home (NYSE:KBH), plummeting 15.5% premarket on an earnings miss...

    It's too far too fast for KB Home (NYSE:KBH), plummeting 15.5% premarket on an earnings miss after a 67% moonshot in the shares YTD. Q1 net orders of 1,197 were off 8% from 2011 Q1. Gross margin declined to 9.7% from 12.6% a year ago. Order backlogs represent $460M in sales against $353.6M this time last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM | 6 Comments
  • KBH

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH): FQ1 EPS of $-0.59 misses by $0.36. Revenue of $254.6M (+29.3% Y/Y) misses by...

    KB Home (NYSE:KBH): FQ1 EPS of $-0.59 misses by $0.36. Revenue of $254.6M (+29.3% Y/Y) misses by $82M. Shares -11.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM
  • MWW

    Baird upgrades Monster Worldwide (NYSE:MWW) to Outperform from Neutral and bumps up its price...

    Baird upgrades Monster Worldwide (NYSE:MWW) to Outperform from Neutral and bumps up its price target to $15 from $11. Yesterday, Monster's CEO tipped off that the company is still on the radar of potential buyers. Shares of MWW +2.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:09 AM
  • CPRI

    Michael Kors (KORS) prices its previously announced secondary offering at $47 a share. The...

    Michael Kors (KORS) prices its previously announced secondary offering at $47 a share. The secondary offering is expected to close on or about March 28. Shares of KORS -1.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 AM
  • MOS

    Shares of Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) move up 2.2% in premarket trading after JPMorgan chimes in with an...

    Shares of Mosaic (NYSE:MOS) move up 2.2% in premarket trading after JPMorgan chimes in with an upgrade to Overweight from Neutral and sets a price target of $68. Analysts with JP point to Mosaic's recent settlements over potash production disputes as a revenue driver.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:25 AM
  • TVIX

    Credit Suisse will restart issuance of TVIX ETN units today. It was the suspension of such last...

    Credit Suisse will restart issuance of TVIX ETN units today. It was the suspension of such last month that led to the units massive premium to NAV, much, but not all of which melted away yesterday - no doubt because the market expected today's announcement. TVIX -16% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:16 AM | 2 Comments
  • BT

    BT Group (NYSE:BT) announces a new pension funding plan, paying in £2B this year and then...

    BT Group (NYSE:BT) announces a new pension funding plan, paying in 2B this year and then 325M annually for the next nine years, a marked improvement from the existing 17-year plan with annual payments starting at 525M and then rising. Shares +4.3% in London, as investors believe the revised plan will be less of a drag on dividend payouts.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 AM
